subtitle: hello my friends
just the other day a couple came to see
me
and they were talking about with their
little daughter actually and they were
talking about the birthday party they
just had for her seventh birthday
and she was so excited I shared and I
asked her so tell me share with me what
happened at the party he said well they
brought this beautiful cake besides all
the gifts it's beautiful whipped cream
cake and they put seven candles in there
lit the candles and I blew them all out
in one shot with my mouth
and I had a flashback to a story that I
heard from my good friend and colleague
Maria Cohen who lives today in Israel
she shared with me and she actually
posted something on our website called
the candle of gods so you can check it
out
a story that happened with her little
niece Galia
that she went to the first time she
attempt she was a two-year-old little
girl she went to attend the first time a
birthday party
and as they brought the cake with the
candles
um everybody all the little girls and
all the kids got ready to go ahead one
two three ready to go together puff
enough and blow the candles out well
Galia you know what she did she took her
hands and she weighed three times and
circled and covered her eyes
and as she does when you light a candle
for Shabbat or the holidays
and it was a tremendous lesson and I
think I want to make a suggestion maybe
a revolutionary suggestion see if a
candle represents the soul
in the Book of Proverbs it says the
flame of God is the soul of the human
being and like a flame that's alive and
flickering and licking the air and
transcending our souls too are alive a
flame warms and illuminates
its environment so to our souls of the
woman illuminate so why would we want to
blow out a candle on a birthday
we'd want to light candles so my
suggestion is going forward when you
have a see a cake put the candles in
there and let the birthday
child girl or boy light the candles and
let everybody light the candles with
them so instead of blowing them out
let's light the candle subtle things
like this send a message and I'm happy I
wish happy birthday to anyone's having a
birthday but we all have a birthday
sometime of the year and that's the
suggestion of the day the light candles
instead of blowing them out be well and
illuminate and warm your world
